title: Authors and Citation
text: Yannick Marcon. Author, maintainer. OBiBa group. Copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Marcon Y (2025). amberr: 'Amber' Electronic Data Capture Client. R package version 1.2.0, https://www.obiba.org/amberr/, https://www.obiba.org/pages/products/amber/, https://github.com/obiba/amberr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {amberr: 'Amber' Electronic Data Capture Client},   author = {Yannick Marcon},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.2.0,     https://www.obiba.org/amberr/,     https://www.obiba.org/pages/products/amber/},   url = {https://github.com/obiba/amberr/}, }

title: Amber Electronic Data Capture Client
text: R package accessing OBiBa/Amber web services: list users groups list studies, forms, form revisions, case report forms interview designs extract case report interview records full data dictionary

title: Amber Electronic Data Capture Client
code: # Install from source code repository remotes::install_github("obiba/amberr")

title: Amber Electronic Data Capture Client
text: Steps: open connection Amber server extract process documents close connection Amber server Examples: user group queries study form queries case report form record queries save Opal analysis interview designs, campaigns, participants record queries save Opal analysis

title: Get a campaign — amber.campaign
text: Get interview design campaign name identifier.

title: Get a campaign — amber.campaign
code: amber.campaign(amber, id, study = NULL, interviewDesign = NULL, query = list())

title: Get a campaign — amber.campaign
text: amber Amber object id Interview design's name identifier study Study identifier (name id), optional. interviewDesign Interview design identifier (name id), optional. query search query

title: Get a campaign — amber.campaign
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") amber.campaign(a, id = "base", interviewDesign = "Adult trauma - baseline") amber.logout(a) } # }

title: Get the campaigns — amber.campaigns
code: amber.campaigns(   amber,   study = NULL,   interviewDesign = NULL,   query = list(),   skip = 0,   limit = 100,   df = TRUE )

title: Get the campaigns — amber.campaigns
text: amber Amber object study Study identifier (name id), optional. interviewDesign Interview design identifier (name id), optional. query search query skip Number items skip limit Max number items df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the campaigns — amber.campaigns
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") amber.campaigns(a) amber.campaigns(a, study="Liftup", interviewDesign = "Treocapa") amber.logout(a) } # }

what: Export the case report records — amber.case_report_export
title: Export the case report records — amber.case_report_export
text: Export case report records one several form(s).

title: Export the case report records — amber.case_report_export
code: amber.case_report_export(   amber,   study = NULL,   form = NULL,   caseReportForm = NULL,   from = NULL,   to = NULL,   pId = NULL,   query = list(),   skip = 0,   limit = 100,   df = TRUE )

title: Export the case report records — amber.case_report_export
text: amber Amber object study Study identifier (name id), optional. form Form identifier (name id), optional. caseReportForm Case report form identifier (name id), optional. date (included), optional date (included), optional pId Patient/participant identifier query search query skip Number items skip limit Max number items df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Export the case report records — amber.case_report_export
text: named list data.frames, data dictionary data data.frame per form revision (named list raw results 'df' FALSE)

title: Export the case report records — amber.case_report_export
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org")  # Find all case reports amber.case_report_export(a)  # Find all case reports in a range of time amber.case_report_export(a, from = "2022-01-12 00:00", to = "2022-02-13")  # Find all case reports for a specific participant/patient identifier amber.case_report_export(a, pId = "1231")  # Find all case reports having their identifier matching a regular expression amber.case_report_export(a, query = list(`data._id[$search]` = "^12"))  # Find all case reports which form data is equal to some value # (will not work if the data are encrypted in the database) amber.case_report_export(a, query = list(data.PATIENT.ORIGIN_REGION = "xyz"))  # Export records collected with a study's form in a specific version amber.case_report_export(a,   study = "Trauma Registry",   form = "Adult trauma",   query = list(revision = 6))  # Export records collected with a specific case report form tables <- amber.case_report_export(a, caseReportForm = "Adult trauma - test")  # Export records collected with a study's form in all versions used tables <- amber.case_report_export(a,   study = "Trauma Registry",   form = "Adult trauma")  # Result contains both data and dictionary tables  # Tables are named with the <case report form name>-<revision> pattern names(tables)  # Merge datasets from different versions if relevant dplyr::bind_rows(lapply(tables, function (t) {   t$data }))  amber.logout(a) } # }

what: Get a case report form — amber.case_report_form
title: Get a case report form — amber.case_report_form
text: Get case report form name identifier revision number ().

title: Get a case report form — amber.case_report_form
code: amber.case_report_form(   amber,   id,   study = NULL,   form = NULL,   revision = NULL,   query = list() )

title: Get a case report form — amber.case_report_form
text: amber Amber object id Case report form's name identifier study Study identifier (name id), optional. form Form's name identifier revision Revision number, optional, default NULL (means case report form uses latest form revision). query search query, desambiguate form lookup name

title: Get a case report form — amber.case_report_form
text: case report form object named list

title: Get a case report form — amber.case_report_form
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") amber.case_report_form(a, id = "Adult trauma - baseline", form = "Adult trauma", revision = 10) amber.case_report_form(a, id = "61e69a22fea2df2f3108b508") amber.logout(a) } # }

what: Get the case report forms — amber.case_report_forms
title: Get the case report forms — amber.case_report_forms
text: Get case reports one several form(s).

title: Get the case report forms — amber.case_report_forms
code: amber.case_report_forms(   amber,   study = NULL,   form = NULL,   revision = NULL,   query = list(),   skip = 0,   limit = 100,   df = TRUE )

title: Get the case report forms — amber.case_report_forms
text: amber Amber object study Study identifier (name id), optional. form Form identifier (name id), optional. revision Revision number, optional, default NULL (means case report form uses latest form revision). query search query skip Number items skip limit Max number items df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the case report forms — amber.case_report_forms
Get the case report forms — amber.case_report_forms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") amber.case_report_forms(a, form="61e69a22fea2df2f3108b508", skip=0, limit=10) amber.case_report_forms(a, form="Adult trauma") amber.case_report_forms(a, study="Trauma Registry", query = list(revision = 1)) amber.case_report_forms(a, query = list(revision = 1)) amber.logout(a) } # }

what: Get the case report records — amber.case_reports
title: Get the case report records — amber.case_reports
text: Get case report records one several form(s).

title: Get the case report records — amber.case_reports
code: amber.case_reports(   amber,   study = NULL,   form = NULL,   caseReportForm = NULL,   from = NULL,   to = NULL,   pId = NULL,   query = list(),   skip = 0,   limit = 100,   df = TRUE )

title: Get the case report records — amber.case_reports
text: amber Amber object study Study identifier (name id), optional. form Form identifier (name id), optional. caseReportForm Case report form identifier (name id), optional. date (included), optional date (included), optional pId Patient/participant identifier query search query skip Number items skip limit Max number items df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the case report records — amber.case_reports
Get the case report records — amber.case_reports
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org")  # Find all case reports amber.case_reports(a)  # Find all case reports in a range of time amber.case_reports(a, from = "2022-01-12 00:00", to = "2022-02-13")  # Find all case reports for a specific participant/patient identifier amber.case_reports(a, pId = "1231")  # Find all case reports having their identifier matching a regular expression amber.case_reports(a, query = list(`data._id[$search]` = "^12"))  # Find all case reports which form data is equal to some value # (will not work if the data are encrypted in the database) amber.case_reports(a, query = list(data.PATIENT.ORIGIN_REGION = "xyz"))  # Export records collected with a study's form in a specific version amber.case_reports(a,   study = "Trauma Registry",   form = "Adult trauma",   query = list(revision = 6))  # Export records collected with a specific case report form amber.case_reports(a, caseReportForm = "Adult trauma - test")  # Export records collected with a study's form in all versions used amber.case_reports(a,   study = "Trauma Registry",   form = "Adult trauma")  amber.logout(a) } # }

code: amber.form(amber, id, study = NULL, query = list())

text: amber Amber object id Interview design's name identifier study Study identifier (name id), optional. query search query

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") amber.interview_design(a, id = "Adult trauma - baseline") amber.interview_design(a, id = "61e69a22fea2df2f3108b508") amber.logout(a) } # }

code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") amber.interview_designs(a) amber.interview_designs(a, study="Liftup") amber.logout(a) } # }

title: Export the interview records — amber.interview_export
text: Export interview records (data dictionary) interview step(s).

title: Export the interview records — amber.interview_export
code: amber.interview_export(   amber,   study = NULL,   interviewDesign = NULL,   campaign = NULL,   from = NULL,   to = NULL,   completed = NULL,   code = NULL,   identifier = NULL,   state = NULL,   participantValid = NULL,   query = list(),   skip = 0,   limit = 100,   df = TRUE )

title: Export the interview records — amber.interview_export
text: amber Amber object study Study identifier (name id), optional. interviewDesign Interview design identifier (name id), optional. campaign Campaign identifier (name id), optional. date (included), optional date (included), optional completed TRUE export data completed interviews (default NULL) code Participant interview code identifier Patient/participant study identifier state State interview: 'initiated', 'in_progress', 'completed' participantValid Participant valid (logical): active valid date range query search query skip Number items skip limit Max number items df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Export the interview records — amber.interview_export
text: named list data.frames, data dictionary data data.frame per form revision (named list raw results 'df' FALSE)

title: Export the interview records — amber.interview_export
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org")  # Extract data from all interviews amber.interview_export(a)  # Extract data from all completed interviews amber.interview_export(a, completed = TRUE)  # Extract data from all interviews in a range of time amber.interview_export(a, from = "2022-01-12 00:00", to = "2022-02-13")  # Extract data from all interviews for a specific participant/patient # study identifier amber.interview_export(a, identifier = "1231")  # Extract data from all interviews having their participant study # identifier matching a regular expression amber.interview_export(a, query = list(`identifier[$search]` = "^12"))  # Extract data from all interviews having their participant attributes # matching a value # (will not work if the data are encrypted in the database) amber.interview_export(a, query = list(data.country = "fr"))  # Export records collected with a study's interview design tables <- amber.interview_export(a,   study = "liftup",   interviewDesign = "treocapa_lt")  # Result contains both data and dictionary tables  # Tables are named with the <interview design name>-<form name>-<revision> pattern names(tables)  # Merge datasets from different versions if relevant dplyr::bind_rows(lapply(tables, function (t) {   t$data }))  amber.logout(a) } # }

title: Get the interview records — amber.interviews
text: Get interviews one several interview design(s).

title: Get the interview records — amber.interviews
code: amber.interviews(   amber,   study = NULL,   interviewDesign = NULL,   campaign = NULL,   from = NULL,   to = NULL,   code = NULL,   identifier = NULL,   state = NULL,   participantValid = NULL,   query = list(),   skip = 0,   limit = 100,   mergeUpdatedFillingDates = FALSE,   df = TRUE )

title: Get the interview records — amber.interviews
text: amber Amber object study Study identifier (name id), optional. interviewDesign Interview design identifier (name id), optional. campaign Campaign identifier (name id), optional. date (included), optional date (included), optional code Participant interview code, optional identifier Participant identifier, optional state State interview: 'initiated', 'in_progress', 'completed' participantValid Participant valid (logical): active valid date range query search query skip Number items skip limit Max number items mergeUpdatedFillingDates Set last update date filling date, filling date empty (default FALSE). df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the interview records — amber.interviews
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org")  # Find all interviews amber.interviews(a)  # Find all interviews in a range of time amber.interviews(a, from = "2022-01-12 00:00", to = "2022-02-13")  # Find all interviews for a specific participant/patient study identifier amber.interviews(a, identifier = "1231")  # Find all interviews having their identifier matching a regular expression amber.interviews(a, query = list(`data._id[$search]` = "^12"))  # Find all interviews which form data is equal to some value # (will not work if the data are encrypted in the database) amber.interviews(a, query = list(data.PATIENT.ORIGIN_REGION = "xyz"))  # Find interview records of a study amber.interviews(a, study = "Trauma Registry")  amber.logout(a) } # }

what: Get the actions of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_actions
title: Get the actions of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_actions
Get the actions of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_actions
code: amber.interviews_step_actions(steps, step_name)

title: Get the actions of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_actions
text: steps data frame interviews steps step_name name step

title: Get the actions of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_actions
Get the actions of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_actions
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org")  # Find interview records of a study itws <- amber.interviews(a, study = "Trauma Registry")  # Get steps steps <- amber.interviews_steps(itws)  # Get actions of the step with name QUESTIONNAIRE actions <- amber.interviews_step_actions(steps, 'QUESTIONNAIRE')  # Count the number of completed QUESTIONNAIRE steps ('complete' action type) # in completed interviews ('completed' state) actions %>% filter(state == 'completed', type == 'complete') %>% count()  amber.logout(a) } # }

what: Get the data of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_data
title: Get the data of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_data
Get the data of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_data
code: amber.interviews_step_data(steps, step_name)

title: Get the data of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_data
text: steps data frame interviews steps step_name name step

title: Get the data of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_data
Get the data of some interviews step — amber.interviews_step_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org")  # Find interview records of a study itws <- amber.interviews(a, study = "Trauma Registry")  # Get steps steps <- amber.interviews_steps(itws)  # Get data of the step with name CONSENT consent_data <- amber.interviews_step_data(steps, 'CONSENT')  # Count per agreement values (possible values are 0 or 1) consent_data %>% count(AGREEMENT)  amber.logout(a) } # }

what: Get the steps of interview records — amber.interviews_steps

code: amber.interviews_steps(interviews)

title: Get the steps of interview records — amber.interviews_steps
Get the steps of interview records — amber.interviews_steps
Get the steps of interview records — amber.interviews_steps
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org")  # Find interview records of a study itws <- amber.interviews(a, study = "Trauma Registry")  # Get steps steps <- amber.interviews_steps(itws)  amber.logout(a) } # }

what: Opan a connection with Amber — amber.login
title: Opan a connection with Amber — amber.login
text: Open connection Amber returns Amber object.  two-factor authentication mechanism enabled, user prompt one-time password input.

title: Opan a connection with Amber — amber.login
code: amber.login(   username = getOption("amber.username", "anonymous"),   password = getOption("amber.password", "password"),   url = getOption("amber.url"),   opts = getOption("amber.opts", list()) )

title: Opan a connection with Amber — amber.login
text: username User name Amber. Can provided "amber.username" option. password User password Amber. Can provided "amber.password" option. url Amber url. Can provided "amber.url" option. Secure http (https) connection required. opts Curl options. Can provided "amber.opts" option.

title: Opan a connection with Amber — amber.login
text: Amber object amber connection object used function calls

title: Opan a connection with Amber — amber.login
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # login using credentials from amber.username and amber.password options a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") # login by providing credentials a <- amber.login("administrator", "password", "https://amber-demo.obiba.org") } # }

title: Close connection with Amber — amber.logout
code: amber.logout(amber)

title: Close connection with Amber — amber.logout
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") amber.logout(a) } # }

title: Get a participant — amber.participant
text: Get interview design campaign participant code identifier.

title: Get a participant — amber.participant
code: amber.participant(   amber,   code,   study = NULL,   interviewDesign = NULL,   campaign = NULL,   query = list() )

title: Get a participant — amber.participant
text: amber Amber object code Participant's code study Study identifier (name id), optional. interviewDesign Interview design identifier (name id), optional. campaign Campaign identifier (name id), optional. query search query

title: Get a participant — amber.participant
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org") amber.campaign(a, id = "base", interviewDesign = "Adult trauma - baseline") amber.logout(a) } # }

title: Get the participants — amber.participants
text: Get participants one several interview design campaign(s).

title: Get the participants — amber.participants
code: amber.participants(   amber,   study = NULL,   interviewDesign = NULL,   campaign = NULL,   code = NULL,   identifier = NULL,   valid = NULL,   query = list(),   skip = 0,   limit = 100,   df = TRUE )

title: Get the participants — amber.participants
text: amber Amber object study Study identifier (name id), optional. interviewDesign Interview design identifier (name id), optional. campaign Campaign identifier (name id), optional. code Participant interview code, optional identifier Participant identifier, optional valid Participant valid (logical): active valid date range query search query skip Number items skip limit Max number items df Return data.frame (default TRUE)

title: Get the participants — amber.participants
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ a <- amber.login("https://amber-demo.obiba.org")  # Find all participants amber.participants(a)  # Find all participants for a specific participant/patient study identifier amber.participants(a, identifier = "1231")  # Find all participants which data is equal to some value # (will not work if the data are encrypted in the database) amber.participants(a, query = list(data.country = "fr"))  # Find the participants of a study interview campaign amber.participants(a, study = "Liftup", campaign = "base")  amber.logout(a) } # }
